 OK I'll bite. But I must first preface that in order for the following to be true one would have to assume there is actually a God and a Satan and the bible is the written word of the same. Of which, I do not.
 
 1Ch 19:18 But the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of the Syrians seven thousand [men which fought in] chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host. 
 
 Gen 6:17 And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein [is] the breath of life, from under heaven; [and] every thing that [is] in the earth shall die.
 
 Later, in Hosea, we learn that because the land of Samaria rejected God, "Samaria shall become desolate; for she hath rebelled against her God: they shall fall by the sword: their infants shall be dashed in pieces, and their women with child shall be ripped up" (Hosea 13:16). 
 
 "Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones" (Psalms 137:9)
 
 According to Deuteronomy, if a child is unruly and disobedient, we not only have the option of killing him, but it is mandatory that he be stoned to death (Deuteronomy 21:18-21). The same is true for a child who speaks to us with foul language (Exodus 21:17). Or a child who hits us (Exodus 21:15). 
 
 God's burning of folks (Numbers 11:1), breaking bones (Numbers 24:8), inflicting stabbings, famine and pestilence (Jeremiah 42:15-17; Ezekiel 5:11-13), feeding people their own flesh (Isaiah 49:26) and ripping sinners' babies and unborn infants to shreds (Hosea 13:16), not to mention drowning everyone (except Noah and his family) during a particularly stressful time (Genesis 7:17-21). 
 
 That's about all I can handle....think I'm gonna hurl. emoticon_cry

 Of all the scripture I have read, the character of God was, in fact, a cruel diety. However, his cruelty, or wrath if you will, was always a result of defience to his laws and not done for some sick, demented "Bwa-ha-ha I am God!!" reason.

I cannot and would not hitch my wagon to any diety that would punish their children, as the god of the old testament was reported to have, be he the god of heaven in the white hat OR the god of hell with the horns of a goat. Cruel is cruel. Period.
 
 It is usually at this point of the dialog that the religious say to me, "But that was the OLD testament. Through the blood of Jesus Christ we are under a new covenant. In the old times, god held up one end of the rope and mankind held up the other. If mankind dropped it's end, it was doomed to the wrath of God. But Jesus delivered us from this bondage through his divine grace and our yoke has been removed and our burden has been lightened. Jesus now holds up the other end of the rope for us. All you have to do is hang on somewhere in the middle. He has already died for your sins. All have sinned and fall short of the glory of god but through the acceptance of Jesus Christ as your savior, you can and will be saved."
 
 That's usually the time when my head feels like I just stepped off the merry-go-round and I hear the quacking of ducks. Go figure....

 I hope you can follow my explanation, as is, without a lot of detail: God is much more than just a spirit. The Bible tells us that we are to focus on God as all-in-all and everywhere. I realize that's hard to grasp, for even the concept of Him being Father, Son, and Holy Spirit is hard to swallow. But that same "trinity" is what we are, except we are body, spirit and soul - all in one.
 
 Also we have His image in that we can communicate with Him and He with us.
 
 In another way we are able to build, fabricate, and/or manufacture things - this also is a reflection of our creation ability given by God.
 
 Short but sweet, hopefully.

 dogma, bias and sbjectivity are the fundamentals of most religions. in christianity this is very prevalent because it explicitly requires you to believe that christianity is the only true religion, and all other religions are false. any religion of this opinion will have a particularly strong dogma, referring to those outside their religion as infidels and outcasts, and putting themselves on an elevated level of morality and godliness
 
 because of this, any questioning of such a religion will be taken as a direct attack on the members of the religion, and they will feel compelled to retaliate in the face of these attacks. not only is there a deep emotional attachment, blurring any logic and reality, but they already have the sense of superiority in their religion, and any "infidel" with the audacity to mock their beliefs and threaten their moral status deserves to be trampled
 
 now it gets really interesting. today, there are many christians that would like to disassociate themselves from the group of condescending over-zealous fundamentalists, so they adopt a more "tolerant" approach to those that question christianity. as a result, they must drop their belief in a substantial portion of the bible in order to do this. their belief is more based on what is politically correct than what is biblical. what's really ironic is that these same christians turn around and act morally superior to the fundamentalist church members
 
 so here's your choices. your question will either be answered by the fundamentalist, whose view is completely bible-based, but so infected with emotional rhetoric and bias its almost useless; or you'll be answered by the "liberal" christian, who essentially knows very little bible-wise, and will try to answer in the most politically format possible, making their response just as useless

 Express:
 1.To set forth in words; state. 
 2.To manifest or communicate, as by a gesture; show. See synonyms at vent.
 3.To make known the feelings or opinions of (oneself), as by statement or art. 
 4.To convey or suggest a representation of; depict: The painting expresses the rage of war victims. 
 5.To represent by a sign or a symbol; symbolize: express a fraction as a decimal. 
 6.To squeeze or press out, as juice from an orange. 
 7.To send by special messenger or rapid transport: express a package to Los Angeles. 
 8.Genetics. 
 a.To cause (itself) to produce an effect or a phenotype. Used of a gene: The gene expressed itself under specific environmental conditions. 
 b.To manifest the effects of (a gene): Half of the people who inherit the gene express it. 
 c.To manifest (a genetic trait): All the mice in the study expressed the defect.
 
 Image:
 1.A reproduction of the form of a person or object, especially a sculptured likeness. 
 2.Physics. An optically formed duplicate, counterpart, or other representative reproduction of an object, especially an optical reproduction formed by a lens or mirror. 
 3.One that closely or exactly resembles another; a double: He is the image of his uncle. 
 4.
 a.The opinion or concept of something that is held by the public. 
 b.The character projected to the public, as by a person or institution, especially as interpreted by the mass media.
 5.A personification of something specified: That child is the image of good health. 
 6.A mental picture of something not real or present. 
 7.
 a.A vivid description or representation. 
 b.A figure of speech, especially a metaphor or simile. 
 c.A concrete representation, as in art, literature, or music, that is expressive or evocative of something else: night as an image of death.
 8.Mathematics. A set of values of a function corresponding to a particular subset of a domain. 
 9.Computer Science. An exact replica of the contents of a storage device, such as a hard disk, stored on a second storage device, such as a network server. 
 10.Obsolete. An apparition.

 think of it this way. god is the original guitar performance, man is the analog recording (or even the digital cd-quality, surround-sound stereo recording). yes, what was performed is captured in the recording, but it cannot be substituted or even considered equal to the actual live performance. as perfectly captured as you can accomplish a recording of the performance, experiencing the performance through quality headphones or speakers will never have the same effect as being there at the live performance. yes, all the notes and chords are there, but its still just a copy, and therefore still an inferior version of the real thing.

We well know of the sin of Lucifer, who was given free will by God, but God did not bring about that state or action - Lucifer did.
